alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Chilton; Clay; Cleburne; Coosa; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 8:26PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Talladega, northeastern Chilton, southeastern Calhoun, Cleburne, Coosa and Clay Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 826 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pleasant Gap to near Talladega to near Logan Martin Dam to near Thorsby. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Talladega, Sylacauga, Jacksonville, Clanton, Childersburg, Piedmont, Heflin, Lineville, Ashland, Goodwater, Rockford, Kellyton, Talladega Springs, Weogufka, Cobb Town, Fort McClellan, Saks and West End-Cobb Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.
